I want to convey our condolences messages to the brotherly Pakistan people who lost their hearts yesterday.

We have launched the Dubai 2021 Plan which sets the general framework for our development efforts over the next seven years
The first goal of the plan is to make people happy and comfortable ... and we have great confidence in all those concerned and their ability to reach this goal
The future is full of opportunities, but it is not free of challenges ... and our willingness to deal positively with the future holds us to confirm our chances of winning the best always
Our people will not be satisfied except in the first place ... This requires everyone effort, perseverance and serious work in the spirit of one team and we expect everyone to participate effectively
We will follow closely the stages of implementation of the plan and the measurement indicators adopted will be the eye that we monitor the progress of work in its six axes
Our ambition for our people and our nation is its limits, the sky ... and success imposes upon us a great responsibility to preserve it and develop its fruits
I am in Placencia where I meet with the Prime Minister of Belize, Dean Barrow prior to the #SICA Summit
We have proudly launched today the Dubai Plan 2021 which shows our development framework over the next seven years.
The 1st objective for the Dubai plan 2021 is achieving people happiness. We have full confidence in those responsible to fulfill this goal.
The future is full of opportunities, yet challenges exist too. But facing the future with positive energy will always ensure the best
We will thoroughly monitor the plan's implementation & measure the workflow through a set of KPI's along 6 main cases.

RT @teleSURtv: #AHORA | President of Brazil, @ dilmabr begins his speech at the Summit of #Mercosur http://t.co/tqMKHfCBj8
The tweeting advice now excerpts from the speech of President Dilma at a meeting of #Mercosul, Argentina.
RT @blogplanalto: #AoVivo - President Dilma addresses the 47th Summit of the #Mercosul Summit: http://t.co/e88Pl4ISCW
Time only reinforces the historical importance of #Mercosul in the consolidation of the idea of ​​shared development between our countries (...)
(...) and the strengthening of our democracies. #Mercosul
This year, we have witnessed vibrant electoral processes with broad popular participation in two full members, Uruguay and Brazil (...)
(...) and sister countries, Bolivia and Colombia. #Mercosul
This celebration of democracy engrandece #Mercosul and was unthinkable in South America a few decades ago.
Since the creation of the bloc, trade between our countries has grown by more than 12 times. We jumped from US $ 4.5 billion to almost US $ 60 billion in 2013.
This growth is higher than the evolution of world trade as a whole. It puts us in a situation of comfort, but of challenge. #Mercosul
We grew with the accession of Venezuela in 2012, and we will soon have Bolivia. #Mercosul
Our trade is of quality, with expressive participation of goods and services with high added value. #Mercosul
We must actively work to recover the intrabloc trade flow, seeking joint solutions (...)
(...) that allow us to resume the upward trajectory of our exchanges, in an environment with clear rules, based on the commercial disciplines.
#Mercosul citizens can travel without the need for visas or passports and have facilities to reside in any country on the block.
The decision to adopt a unique vehicle identification plate is yet another step in that direction. #Mercosul
This month, the Meeting of Authorities on Indigenous Peoples was established during the pro tempore presidency of Venezuela.
In the next semester, under the Brazilian presidency, we will establish the Specialized Meeting on Afro-descendant Rights.
Our development model was geared towards social inclusion, each of our countries sought to strengthen the social justice part.
We partially attenuate the effects of the 2008 financial crisis, with policies aimed at defending employment, income and fighting poverty.
The circumstances, however, are more difficult today. World trade growth fell from 12.8% in 2010 to 3% in 2013.
The recovery of the US economy was not reflected in the resumption of its level of pre-crisis consumption. #Mercosul
RT @GuatemalaGob: President @ottoperezmolina arrived in Placencia, Belize, to participate in the #SICA Summit http://t.co/G05zGFCYtM
In the face of the world scenario, we must double our focus on regional integration, as a means of strengthening our capacities and alternatives.
Our determination is clear: to make #Mercosul a strong customs union.
At the #Unasul Summit, two weeks ago, Brazil defended as priority actions the deepening of integration in infrastructure (...)
(...) and the advancement of the discussions for productive diversification and value added. #Mercosul
Crucial point of the Brazilian pro tempore presidency is the renewal of the Fund for the Structural Convergence of #Mercosul (Focem).
With 45 projects totaling 1.45 billion dollars, the fund has been funding since 2005 initiatives in areas such as energy, infrastructure (...)
(...) sanitation and housing, with direct results in improving the lives of our populations. #Mercosul
It is a pleasure and honor to take up the presidency pro tempore of #Mercosul again.
In the coming semester, we will deepen the discussions on all the issues to which I have referred, especially the future of the customs union (...)
(...) the definition of a joint strategy for international insertion and improvement of institutional mechanisms. #Mercosul
Brazil will strive in every way for #Mercosul to continue advancing. I tell you, in this endeavor, with the help of everyone.
To the companion Mujica I express my joy for the privilege of having counted on his conviviality, friendship and collaboration in the last 4 years.

Mevlana, the residence of Alamut Castle, lived only a century after Hasan Sabbah; it was a conquest of the fake scholars.
Mevlana fell into the colorful paint cube of false religion guides, and among his friends, "I am a peacock bird." he likes boisterous coyotes.
There are such scholars that after their deaths, their works and works will not be forgotten for centuries.
There are also those who wear such masks, so that when they are still alive, the foyer of their own, and those who rely on them, will come out.
It is eternal praise to Allah, this holy nation, Hasan Sabbah, fake prophets, has been preserved against modern Yazidis.
